versions.title: Language Proficiency
versions.definition: Describes the level of proficiency of an individual in a natural language.
versions.notes: This vocabulary was first published by the DDI Alliance. Please see: https://ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies/all.
versions.citation: DDI Alliance. (2020). Language Proficiency (Version 1.0) [Controlled vocabulary]. CESSDA. urn:ddi:int.ddi.cv:LanguageProficiency:1.0.
versions.ddiUsage:
DDI3.3

Module name: archive

Element name: Read

 Write

DDI 3.2 

Module name: archive

DDI 2.5

DDI-Codebook (DDI 2.5 and all previous DDI versions) does not include an element or attribute that would support this controlled vocabulary.

concepts.title: Native
concepts.definition: The individual is a native user of the language whose level of proficiency is unknown/unspecified.

concepts.title: Native: Fluent
concepts.definition: The individual is a native user with excellent mastery of the language, including breadth of vocabulary and idiom, and confident command of the grammar.

concepts.title: Native: Good
concepts.definition: The individual is a native user of the language with good structural accuracy, vocabulary and comprehension.

concepts.title: Native: Basic
concepts.definition: The individual is a native user of the language with limited vocabulary, use of grammar and comprehension.

concepts.title: Non-native
concepts.definition: The individual is a non-native user of the language whose level of proficiency is unknown/unspecified.

concepts.title: Non-native: Fluent
concepts.definition: The individual is a non-native user with excellent mastery of the language, including breadth of vocabulary and idiom, and confident command of the grammar.

concepts.title: Non-native: Good
concepts.definition: The individual is a non-native user of the language with good structural accuracy, vocabulary and comprehension.

concepts.title: Non-native: Basic
concepts.definition: The individual is a non-native user of the language with limited vocabulary, use of grammar and comprehension.

concepts.title: Unspecified native status
concepts.definition: The individual's native status and her/his level of proficiency are both unknown, or not specified.

concepts.title: Unspecified native status: Fluent
concepts.definition: The individual's native status is unknown/unspecified; s/he has excellent mastery of the language, including breadth of vocabulary and idiom, and confident command of the grammar.

concepts.title: Unspecified native status: Good
concepts.definition: The individual's native status is unknown/unspecified; s/he has good structural accuracy, vocabulary and comprehension.

concepts.title: Unspecified native status: Basic
concepts.definition: The individual's native status is unknown/unspecified; s/he has limited vocabulary, use of grammar, and comprehension.

concepts.title: Other
concepts.definition: Use if level of proficiency is known, but not found in the list. It is recommended that any new entry combine information about the individual's native/non-native status and his/her level of proficiency, following the format [native status].[proficiency level] as shown in the entries above.
